Prerequisites: ACG 2011 IS REQUIRED AND KNOWLEDGE OF BASIC COMPUTER AND KEYBOARDING SKILLS ARE STRONGLY RECOMMENDED.
Course Description: THIS COURSE COVERS THE BASIC PRINCIPLES OF ACCOUNTING TECHNIQUES FOR THE PREPARATION OF INTERNAL REPORTS RELATED TO MANAGEMENT OF THE FIRM AND THE INTERPRETATION OF FINANCIAL DATA USEFUL IN THE DECISION-MAKING PROCESS WITHIN THE ECONOMIC FRAMEWORK OF THE ENTITY.
Objectives / Learning Outcome(s) / Major:
DEMONSTRATE AN UNDERSTANDING OF HOW FINANCIAL INFORMATION WORKS ON A MAKE OR BUY SCENARIO.
BE INTRODUCED TO BUDGETING, BOTH HOW TO BUDGET AND THE MOTIVATIONAL COMPONENTS OF BUDGETING.
BE INTRODUCED TO THE IMPORTANCE OF ETHICS, PROFESSIONAL VALUES AND ATTITUDES AFFECT THE WORKPLACE AND THEIR OWN CAREERS
Textbook(s): WHITTECOTTON, NWFSC MANAGERIAL ACCOUNTING W CONNECT, MCGRAWHILL CUSTOM 9781259963094
Transfer Status: GUARANTEED TRANSFER TO INSTITUTION OFFERING SAME COURSE.
